Appendix:
Drawing automata The drawing of graphs described here uses graphviz , a software for drawing graphs developed at AT \& & & T Labs, that can be obtained at http://www.research.att.com/sw/tools/graphviz/ . Installing some external programs If you work under LINUX, you should install graphviz and create the directory {\textasciitilde} ~/dot-tmp . Functions to draw automata This function draws automaton A writing the needed data in file {\textasciitilde} ~/dot-tmp/file. gap> x:=Automaton("det",3,2,[ [ 2, 3, 0 ], [ 0, 1, 2 ] ],[ 1 ],[ 1, 2, 3 ]);; gap> DrawAutomaton(x,"exx"); The output would be the following diagram displayed in a ghostview window. \begin{figure}[htbp] \begin{center} \leavevmode \epsfbox{aut2.eps} \end{center} \label{fig:aut2} \end{figure}
